column4: Hi there, i'm doing an rsync on a server, ive just looked at it remotely and its showing as 3 occurences of it running(via ps aux | grep rsync)  is that normal?
Do they all look exactly the same or is there any destinguealbe difference
all look exactly the same :s
whats that mean then?
Can you show me the output for the processes
http://pastebin.com/vLexEPbg
This doesn't look right, I believe those are all copies

yeah i;m thinking so too, i might kill them all and start them from here. I have a query though. i started that rsync at work, im cancelling it from home and will start it again from home, will it be slower?
It should not be noticably slower.  But refer to this article quickly, I've used it to my benefit many times http://sun3.org/archives/280
thanks ill look. you know for bwlimit=whatever  how do i know what I can use as a max?
You could check the man page, but let me see what I get on mine really quick
so if i don't specify anything, its not going to kill my server is it?
No, but if you are worried about it, just pass the command with --bwlimit={how ever much bandwith you can afford to give to it}
i need to rsync 200gb, it was at 500kb but it wasnt doing a lot very fast lol, but i dont wanna set it too much

For me to make a good decision I need to know what both Internet connection speeds run at and what the speed of both networks is; but if you don't want to type all that, just try 256, that's not alot for todays netoworks
Sorry, I mean 128
That's what I would do with my network specs, that's why it is hard to give you a good estimate, alot of variables; but yest.  Just pass rsync saying --bwlimit=128
but 128kbps surely for 200GB is going to take weeks?
My mistake, very sorry.  You're best bet is to just leave it default, default is no limit
It would be 6.5 MBytes per second
how u calculating that?
I just divided the total data needed to copy by the amount of hours you wanted to copy it, divided by minutes than by seconds
I did it all in bytes too, so I might have gotten messed up, but it should be fine! :) Math can be one of my fallys
